data.description: Firm Overview:Cambridge Associates (“CA”) is a leading global investment firm. CA’s goal is to help endowments & foundations, pension plans, and ultra-high net worth private clients implement and manage custom investment portfolios that generate outperformance so that they can maximize their impact on the world. Cambridge Associates delivers a range of services, including outsourced CIO, non-discretionary portfolio management, and investment consulting.Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, CA has offices in key markets in North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Asia, and Oceania.  Our worldwide teams ensure our clients benefit from decades of global presence, local expertise, and relationships with the top global investment managers across the world.  For more information, please visit www.cambridgeassociates.com.Job Description Summary:THE OPPORTUNITYData Analyst Internship ProgramPOSITION SPECIFICSLocation of Position: Boston, MAProgram Length: 10-week program from early June to mid-August (open to rising juniors and seniors: Class of 2026 &2027)Required for Application: ResumeOffice Requirement: Intern is expected to work in their assigned office at least 4 days per week with the option to work from home 1 day per weekExpected Hours: Interns are expected to work 40 hours per weekBase Pay/Salary: Boston, MA: $25 / hour and additionally, offer includes sign-on bonus.Job Description:DATA ANALYST INTERNSHIP PROGRAMThe Data Office at Cambridge Associates is seeking motivated and curious interns to join our team for a 10-week summer program. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on financial services domain knowledge and experience in business and data analysis, data governance, data engineering, and development work that supports our enterprise data initiatives. Interns will work closely with the Chief Data Officer and Data Office team on projects that drive data governance, data quality, master data management (Security Master), and the development of our Snowflake Data Platform.You will be exposed to real-world challenges in data management, analytics, and technology, and will contribute to projects that have a meaningful impact on our organization’s data strategy. This program is designed for students who are eager to learn, collaborate, and develop foundational skills for a career in data and analytics.Responsibilities:Collaborate with Data Office professionals on projects related to business analysis, data governance, data engineering, and development.Support the development and enhancement of the Data Platform, including data integration and automation tasks.Assist in the business and data analysis, design, testing, and implementation of data quality and master data management solutions.Analyze and document business and data requirements for data-related initiatives.Participate in data profiling, data cleansing, and data validation activities.Contribute to the creation of dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to support decision-making.Engage in team meetings, planning sessions, and code reviews.Communicate findings and progress clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Take part in self-guided learning and training sessions to build technical and business knowledge.We Offer:Mentorship from experienced Data Office professionals and the Chief Data Officer.Exposure to enterprise-level data management, governance, and engineering practices.Networking opportunities with leaders across the organization and with other interns.Participation in intern-specific events, employee resource groups, and service council activities.Access to online learning platforms and resources for self-directed skill development.A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive work environment.Qualifications:Current enrollment in a Bachelor’s degree program, ideally in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics, or a related field.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with passion solving complex problems through dataInterest in data management, data engineering, or business analysis.Basic programming experience (Python, SQL, or similar languages preferred).Interest in learning about finance and investment management.Eagerness to learn new technologies and concepts.Effective communication and teamwork skills.Ability to work in a hybrid environment (Boston office).Proactive, detail-oriented, and organized.Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship or restriction now and in the futureHow to Apply:Submit your resume and a brief cover letter describing your interest in data, technology, and how this internship aligns with your career goals.Base salary range for this role:Pay Range Minimum:0Pay Range Maximum:0In addition to the listed salary range, this position is eligible for an annual performance-based bonus and a comprehensive, competitive benefits package. Actual placement within the stated salary range will be determined based on factors such as skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as internal equity.The firm is committed to the concept and practice of equal employment opportunity and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status. It is expected that all employees will follow a similar policy toward their co-workers.
